clinical_study.brief_title: Rollover Study of BMS-354825 in Patients With CML and Ph+ALL
clinical_study.official_title: A Study to Document the Long-Term Safety and Efficacy of BMS-354825 in Subjects With Imatinib Resistant or Intolerant Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia and Philadelphia Chromosome Positive Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia Who Are Resistant or Intolerant to Previous Treatment and Have Completed the Previous Phase I/II Protocol (CA180-031/NCT00337454)

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the safety of dasatinib (BMS-354825) in subjects with Imatinib resistant or intolerant chronic myelogenous leukemia (CML) and Philadelphia chromosome positive (Ph+) acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) who are resistant or intolerant to treatment and will continue study drug after completing the previous Phase I/II study (CA180031/NCT00337454)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Deaths, and Discontinuation
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; every 4 weeks (if on study < 6 months, including CA180-031(NCT00337454); every 12 weeks (if on study >=6 months and <=2 years); every 24 weeks (if on study >2 years); at discontinuation
primary_outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Related AE=relationship of certain, probable, possible, or missing. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants With Chronic Phase CML (CML-CP): Percentage of Participants With Cytogenetic Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, every 24 weeks thereafter (including study CA180031/NCT00337454)
secondary_outcome.description: Cytogenetic responses (CyR) are based on the percentage of Ph+ metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each bone marrow (BM) sample. The criteria for cytogenetic responses are as follows. Best CyR is defined as the best response obtained at any time during the study. Major Cytogenetic Response (MCyR) = Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR; 0 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM), plus Partial Cytogenetic Response (PCyR; 1 - 35 Philadelphia positive [Ph+] Cells in Metaphase in BM).

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants With CML-Accelerated or Blast Phase (AP/BP): Percentage of Participants With Cytogenetic Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, every 12 weeks up to 2 years on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454), every 24 weeks thereafter
secondary_outcome.description: Cytogenetic responses (CyR) are based on the percentage of Ph+ metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each bone marrow (BM) sample. The criteria for cytogenetic responses are as follows. Best CyR is defined as the best response obtained at any time during the study. Major Cytogenetic Response (MCyR) = Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR; 0 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM), plus Partial Cytogenetic Response (PCyR; 1 - 35 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM).

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants With Ph+ Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia (Ph+ ALL): Percentage of Participants With Cytogenetic Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, every 12 weeks up to 2 years on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454), every 24 weeks thereafter
secondary_outcome.description: Cytogenetic responses (CyR) are based on the percentage of Ph+ metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each bone marrow (BM) sample. The criteria for cytogenetic responses are as follows. Best CyR is defined as the best response obtained at any time during the study. secondary_outcome.measure: Participants With CML-CP: Time to Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, every 24 weeks thereafter (including study CA180031/NCT00337454),
secondary_outcome.description: Cytogenetic responses (CyR) are based on the percentage of Ph+ metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each bone marrow (BM) sample. Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) = 0 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM. Time to complete CCyR is defined as the time from first dose of dasatinib until measurement criteria are first met for CCyR, and is computed only for subjects whose best response is CCyR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants With CML-AP/BP and Ph+ ALL: Time to Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, every 12 weeks up to 2 years on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454), every 24 weeks thereafter
secondary_outcome.description: Cytogenetic responses (CyR) are based on the percentage of Ph+ metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each bone marrow (BM) sample. Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) = 0 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM. Time to complete CCyR is defined as the time from first dose of dasatinib until measurement criteria are first met for CCyR, and is computed only for subjects whose best response is CCyR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants With CML-CP: Duration of Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, every 24 weeks thereafter (including study CA180031/NCT00337454)
secondary_outcome.description: Cytogenetic responses (CyR) are based on the percentage of Ph+ metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each bone marrow (BM) sample. Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) = 0 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM. Duration of CCyR was measured from the time measurement criteria are first met for CCyR until the first date of progressed disease (PD) or death. Subjects who neither relapsed nor died will be censored on the date of their last assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants With CML-AP/BP and Ph+ALL: Duration of Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, every 12 weeks up to 2 years on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454), every 24 weeks thereafter

Subjects who neither relapsed nor died will be censored on the date of their last assessment.

Time to MCyR was defined as the time from first dose of dasatinib until measurement criteria were first met for CCyR or PCyR (whichever status is recorded first).

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants With CML-CP: Percentage of Participants With Complete Hematologic Response (CHR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; every 4 weeks < 6 months on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454), every 12 weeks >=6 months and <=2 years; every 24 weeks >2 years; at discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: CHR=all of the following criteria: white blood cell count (WBC) ≤institutional upper limit of normal(ULN); platelets <450,000/mm³; no blasts or promyelocytes in peripheral blood; <5% myelocytes plus metamyelocytes in peripheral blood; peripheral blood basophils <20%; no extramedullary involvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants With CML-AP/BP: Percentage of Participants With Hematologic Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; every 4 weeks < 6 months on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454); every 12 weeks >=6 months and <=2 years; every 24 weeks >2 years; at discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: Major Hematologic Response=Complete Hematologic Response (CHR) or No Evidence of Leukemia (NEL). CHR=WBC <ULN; absolute neutrophil count (ANC) >1,000/mm3; platelets >100,000/mm3; no blasts or promyelocytes in peripheral blood; BM blasts ≤5%; <5% myelocytes + metamyelocytes in peripheral blood; <20% basophils in peripheral blood; no extramedullary involvement. NEL=(see Outcome Measure 15, below). Overall hematologic response (OHR)=best response of CHR, NEL or return to chronic phase (RTC).

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants With Ph+ ALL: Percentage of Participants With Hematologic Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; every 4 weeks < 6 months on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454); every 12 weeks >=6 months and <=2 years; every 24 weeks >2 years; at discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: Major Hematologic Response=Complete Hematologic Response (CHR) or No Evidence of Leukemia (NEL). CHR=(see Outcome Measure 14, above). NEL=WBC ≤ULN; BM blasts ≤5%; no blasts or promyelocytes in peripheral blood; <5% myelocytes plus metamyelocytes in peripheral blood; <20% peripheral blood basophils; no extramedullary involvement; and at least 1 of the following: ANC ≥500/mm3 and <2000/mm3 or platelets ≥20,000/mm3 and <100,000/mm3. Overall hematologic response (OHR)=best response of CHR, NEL or return to chronic phase (RTC).

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Complete Hematologic Response (CHR) in Chronic Phase CML, Accelerated or Blast Phase CML, and Ph+ALL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; every 4 weeks < 6 months on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454); every 12 weeks >=6 months and <=2 years; every 24 weeks >2 years; at discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: CHR=all of the following criteria: WBC ≤institutional upper limit of normal(ULN); platelets <450,000/mm³; no blasts or promyelocytes in peripheral blood; <5% myelocytes plus metamyelocytes in peripheral blood; peripheral blood basophils <20%; no extramedullary involvement. Time to CHR=time from first dose of dasatinib until the first day criteria for CHR are met provided they are confirmed 28 days later and was computed only for chronic phase CML subjects whose best response is CHR. Subjects who neither progressed nor died were censored at date of last hematologic assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Complete Hematologic Response (CHR) in Chronic Phase CML, Accelerated or Blast Phase CML, and Ph+ALL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; every 4 weeks < 6 months on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454); every 12 weeks >=6 months and <=2 years; every 24 weeks >2 years; at discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of CHR was computed only for chronic phase CML subjects whose best response is CHR. It was measured from the first day complete hematologic response criteria are met provided they are confirmed 28 days later until the date treatment is discontinued due to PD or death. Subjects who neither progressed nor died were censored on the date of their last hematologic assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Major Hematologic Response (MaHR) in Accelerated or Blast Phase CML, and Ph+ALL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; every 4 weeks < 6 months on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454); every 12 weeks >=6 months and <=2 years; every 24 weeks >2 years; at discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: Major Hematologic Response=Complete Hematologic Response (CHR) or No Evidence of Leukemia (NEL; see Outcome Measures 14 and 15 for full definitions). Time to major hematologic response (MaHR)=time from first dose of dasatinib until the first day the measurement criteria for MaHR and is computed only for advanced diseases subjects whose best response is a major hematologic response. Subjects who neither progressed nor died were censored on the date of their last hematologic assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Major Hematologic Response (MaHR) in Accelerated or Blast Phase CML, and Ph+ALL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; every 4 weeks < 6 months on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454); every 12 weeks >=6 months and <=2 years; every 24 weeks >2 years; at discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: Major Hematologic Response (MaHR)=Complete Hematologic Response (CHR) or No Evidence of Leukemia (NEL; see Outcome Measures 14 and 15 for full definitions). Subjects who neither progressed nor died were censored on the date of their last hematologic assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Overall Hematologic Response (OHR) in Accelerated or Blast Phase CML, and Ph+ALL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; every 4 weeks < 6 months on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454); every 12 weeks >=6 months and <=2 years; every 24 weeks >2 years; at discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: The overall hematologic response (OHR) rate is defined as the proportion of all treated subjects with a best response of major or minor hematologic response. Time to OHR = time from first dose of dasatinib until the first day measurement criteria are first met for hematologic response provided they were confirmed 28 days later. Subjects who neither progressed nor died were censored on the date of last hematologic assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Overall Hematologic Response (OHR) in Accelerated or Blast Phase CML, and Ph+ALL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline; every 4 weeks < 6 months on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454); every 12 weeks >=6 months and <=2 years; every 24 weeks >2 years; at discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: The overall hematologic response (OHR) rate is defined as the proportion of all treated subjects with a best response of major or minor hematologic response. Subjects who neither progressed nor died were censored on the date of last hematologic assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants With Detectable Mutations of RNA (mRNA) of BCR-ABL at Baseline and at Best Achievement
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, every 12 weeks up to 2 years on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454), every 24 weeks thereafter, and at discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: Detectable BCR-ABL transcripts (b3a2, b2a2 or minor) >=2.0 log copy/micrograms RNA, as measured by real-time quantitative PCR (RQ-PCR) at baseline and best achievement post-dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Status of Point Mutations of BCR-ABL at Baseline (BL) and End of Study (EOS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and discontinuation--the study period was extended until the launch of dasatinib in Japan, January 2009.
secondary_outcome.description: Point mutations of BCR-ABL detected or undetected in the Quantitative real-time PCR polymerase chain reaction (RQ-PCR) products

secondary_outcome.measure: Collection of Blood Samples for Pharmacokinetic Analysis of Dasatinib Twice Daily (BID) That Will Contribute to Population Pharmacokinetic Modeling
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At any visit of later than Day 7, draw sample(s) at pretreatment trough (within 1 hour prior to dosing) or between 3 hours following treatment and prior to the next dose
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for pharmacokinetic analysis of Dasatinib BID that will contribute to population pharmacokinetic modeling were collected.

clinical_study.condition: Philadelphia Chromosome Positive Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia

arm_group.description: CML - Accelerated Phase and Blast Phase

intervention.description: Tablet, Oral, (50mg, 70mg or 90mg BID on a continuous daily dosing schedule), allowed to modify within the range of 50 mg twice daily (BID) to 90 mg BID

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who were eligible and completed the previous Phase I and II study (CA180031/NCT00337454) and for whom the principal investigator has deemed that continuation of study drug is in the best interest of the subject
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women who are pregnant or breastfeeding
- Subjects who are eligible and willing to undergo transplantation at pre-study
- Non-hematologic intolerance to Dasatinib (BMS-354825) in the previous Phase I and II study (CA180031/NCT00337454)

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link: http://www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 55 participants were randomized to study CA180-031; 1 participant with chronic myelogenous leukemia-chronic phase (CML-CP) was withdrawn prior to dosing due to thrombocytopenia. 54 subjects were treated; 44 subjects finished the study period of CA180-031 and transferred CA180-036. Analyses were done on the population enrolled into CA180-031 study.

group.title: CML - Chronic Phase (CML-CP)
group.description: Imatinib resistant or intolerant CML-CP disease cohort who had completed the previous study (CA180031) phase I/II. The study drug was administered twice daily (BID). The starting dose level for this trial in each individual participant was the same dose level at the end of CA180031(ie, 50mg, 70mg or 90mg BID on a continuous daily dosing schedule), allowed to modify within the range of 50 mg twice daily (BID) to 90 mg BID.

group.title: CML - Accelerated Phase and Blast Phase (CML-AP/BP)
group.description: Imatinib resistant or intolerant CML-AP/BP disease cohort who had completed the previous study (CA180031) phase II. The study drug was administered twice daily (BID). The starting dose level for this trial in each individual participant was the same dose level at the end of CA180031 (ie, 50mg, 70mg or 90mg BID on a continuous daily dosing schedule), allowed to modify within the range of 50 mg twice daily (BID) to 90 mg BID.

group.title: Ph+ Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia (Ph+ ALL)
group.description: Philadelphia chromosome positive (Ph+) ALL subjects with resistance or intolerance to past therapy and who had completed the previous study (CA180031) phase II. The study drug was administered twice daily (BID). The starting dose level for this trial in each individual participant was the same dose level at the end of CA180031 (ie, 50mg, 70mg or 90mg BID on a continuous daily dosing schedule), allowed to modify within the range of 50 mg twice daily (BID) to 90 mg BID.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age, Customized
Age
Gender
Region of Enrollment
Eastern Oncology Cooperative Group Performance Status
measure.description: ECOG PS scale is a 6-item scale to assess disease progression, daily functioning, and appropriate treatment and prognosis. Scale=0-5, with 0=fully active, 1=restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory, 2=ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to work, 3= limited selfcare ability and confined to bed/chair >50% of waking hours, 4=completely disabled and no selfcare ability and confined to bed/chair, and 5=death

measure.title: Imatinib Status
measure.description: Resistance to Imatinib=Previously been treated with imatinib at a dose of ≥ 400 mg/day AND developed progressive disease while receiving imatinib at that dose. Intolerance to Imatinib=A subject is defined as being intolerant to imatinib if he or she had a Grade ≥3 toxicity considered at least possibly related to imatinib at a dose of ≤400 mg/day which led to discontinuation of therapy.

measure.title: Body Weight
Height

For AEs leading to discontinuation: 4 in CML-CP=1 insufficient effect (IE) +3 AEs in Participant Flow (PF); 7 in CML-AP/BP= 1 death + 5 AEs + 1 IE in PF; 4 in Ph+ALL=3 IE + 1AE in PF.

The starting dose level for this trial in each individual participant was the same dose level at the end of CA180031, allowed to modify within the range of 50 mg twice daily (BID) to 90 mg BID.

group.title: CML-AP/BP - Imatinib Intolerant
group.description: Imatinib intolerant CML-AP/BP disease cohort who had completed the previous study (CA180031) phase II. The study drug was administered twice daily (BID). The starting dose level for this trial in each individual participant was the same dose level at the end of CA180031, allowed to modify within the range of 50 mg twice daily (BID) to 90 mg BID.

measure.title: Participants With CML-Accelerated or Blast Phase (AP/BP): Percentage of Participants With Cytogenetic Response
measure.description: Cytogenetic responses (CyR) are based on the percentage of Ph+ metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each bone marrow (BM) sample. The criteria for cytogenetic responses are as follows. Best CyR is defined as the best response obtained at any time during the study. Major Cytogenetic Response (MCyR) = Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR; 0 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM), plus Partial Cytogenetic Response (PCyR; 1 - 35 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM).
measure.population: Treated CML-AP/BP participants

outcome.title: Participants With Ph+ Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia (Ph+ ALL): Percentage of Participants With Cytogenetic Response
outcome.description: Cytogenetic responses (CyR) are based on the percentage of Ph+ metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each bone marrow (BM) sample. The criteria for cytogenetic responses are as follows. Best CyR is defined as the best response obtained at any time during the study. Major Cytogenetic Response (MCyR) = Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR; 0 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM), plus Partial Cytogenetic Response (PCyR; 1 - 35 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM).
outcome.time_frame: At baseline, every 12 weeks up to 2 years on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454), every 24 weeks thereafter
outcome.population: Treated Ph+ ALL participants

outcome.title: Participants With CML-CP: Time to Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR)
outcome.description: Cytogenetic responses (CyR) are based on the percentage of Ph+ metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each bone marrow (BM) sample. Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) = 0 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM. Time to complete CCyR is defined as the time from first dose of dasatinib until measurement criteria are first met for CCyR, and is computed only for subjects whose best response is CCyR.
outcome.time_frame: At baseline, every 24 weeks thereafter (including study CA180031/NCT00337454),
outcome.population: Participants achieving CCyR

outcome.title: Participants With CML-CP: Duration of Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR)
outcome.description: Cytogenetic responses (CyR) are based on the percentage of Ph+ metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each bone marrow (BM) sample. Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) = 0 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM. Duration of CCyR was measured from the time measurement criteria are first met for CCyR until the first date of progressed disease (PD) or death. Subjects who neither relapsed nor died will be censored on the date of their last assessment.
outcome.time_frame: At baseline, every 24 weeks thereafter (including study CA180031/NCT00337454)
outcome.population: Participants achieving CCyR. Median duration of CCyR was not yet reached in the CML-CP group.

outcome.title: Participants With CML-CP: Time to Major Cytogenetic Response (MCyR)
outcome.description: Major Cytogenetic Response (MCyR) = Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR; 0 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM), plus Partial Cytogenetic Response (PCyR; 1 - 35 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM). outcome.population: Time to MCyR was computed only for participants whose best response was CCyR or PCyR.

outcome.title: Participants With CML-CP: Percentage of Participants With Complete Hematologic Response (CHR)
outcome.description: CHR=all of the following criteria: white blood cell count (WBC) ≤institutional upper limit of normal(ULN); platelets <450,000/mm³; no blasts or promyelocytes in peripheral blood; <5% myelocytes plus metamyelocytes in peripheral blood; peripheral blood basophils <20%; no extramedullary involvement.
outcome.time_frame: baseline; every 4 weeks < 6 months on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454), every 12 weeks >=6 months and <=2 years; every 24 weeks >2 years; at discontinuation
outcome.population: Treated CML-CP participants

group.title: CML - Chronic Phase (CML-CP) Total

measure.title: Participants With CML-CP: Percentage of Participants With Complete Hematologic Response (CHR)
measure.description: CHR=all of the following criteria: white blood cell count (WBC) ≤institutional upper limit of normal(ULN); platelets <450,000/mm³; no blasts or promyelocytes in peripheral blood; <5% myelocytes plus metamyelocytes in peripheral blood; peripheral blood basophils <20%; no extramedullary involvement.
measure.population: Treated CML-CP participants

outcome.title: Participants With CML-AP/BP: Percentage of Participants With Hematologic Response
outcome.description: Major Hematologic Response=Complete Hematologic Response (CHR) or No Evidence of Leukemia (NEL). CHR=WBC <ULN; absolute neutrophil count (ANC) >1,000/mm3; platelets >100,000/mm3; no blasts or promyelocytes in peripheral blood; BM blasts ≤5%; <5% myelocytes + metamyelocytes in peripheral blood; <20% basophils in peripheral blood; no extramedullary involvement. NEL=(see Outcome Measure 15, below). Overall hematologic response (OHR)=best response of CHR, NEL or return to chronic phase (RTC).
outcome.time_frame: baseline; every 4 weeks < 6 months on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454); every 12 weeks >=6 months and <=2 years; every 24 weeks >2 years; at discontinuation
outcome.population: Treated CML-AP/BP participants

measure.title: Participants With CML-AP/BP: Percentage of Participants With Hematologic Response
measure.description: Major Hematologic Response=Complete Hematologic Response (CHR) or No Evidence of Leukemia (NEL). CHR=WBC <ULN; absolute neutrophil count (ANC) >1,000/mm3; platelets >100,000/mm3; no blasts or promyelocytes in peripheral blood; BM blasts ≤5%; <5% myelocytes + metamyelocytes in peripheral blood; <20% basophils in peripheral blood; no extramedullary involvement. NEL=(see Outcome Measure 15, below). Overall hematologic response (OHR)=best response of CHR, NEL or return to chronic phase (RTC).
measure.population: Treated CML-AP/BP participants

outcome.title: Participants With Ph+ ALL: Percentage of Participants With Hematologic Response
outcome.description: Major Hematologic Response=Complete Hematologic Response (CHR) or No Evidence of Leukemia (NEL). CHR=(see Outcome Measure 14, above). NEL=WBC ≤ULN; BM blasts ≤5%; no blasts or promyelocytes in peripheral blood; <5% myelocytes plus metamyelocytes in peripheral blood; <20% peripheral blood basophils; no extramedullary involvement; and at least 1 of the following: ANC ≥500/mm3 and <2000/mm3 or platelets ≥20,000/mm3 and <100,000/mm3. Overall hematologic response (OHR)=best response of CHR, NEL or return to chronic phase (RTC).
outcome.time_frame: baseline; every 4 weeks < 6 months on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454); every 12 weeks >=6 months and <=2 years; every 24 weeks >2 years; at discontinuation
outcome.population: Treated Ph+ ALL participants

measure.title: Participants With Ph+ ALL: Percentage of Participants With Hematologic Response
measure.description: Major Hematologic Response=Complete Hematologic Response (CHR) or No Evidence of Leukemia (NEL). CHR=(see Outcome Measure 14, above). NEL=WBC ≤ULN; BM blasts ≤5%; no blasts or promyelocytes in peripheral blood; <5% myelocytes plus metamyelocytes in peripheral blood; <20% peripheral blood basophils; no extramedullary involvement; and at least 1 of the following: ANC ≥500/mm3 and <2000/mm3 or platelets ≥20,000/mm3 and <100,000/mm3. Overall hematologic response (OHR)=best response of CHR, NEL or return to chronic phase (RTC).
measure.population: Treated Ph+ ALL participants

outcome.title: Time to Complete Hematologic Response (CHR) in Chronic Phase CML, Accelerated or Blast Phase CML, and Ph+ALL
outcome.description: CHR=all of the following criteria: WBC ≤institutional upper limit of normal(ULN); platelets <450,000/mm³; no blasts or promyelocytes in peripheral blood; <5% myelocytes plus metamyelocytes in peripheral blood; peripheral blood basophils <20%; no extramedullary involvement. Time to CHR=time from first dose of dasatinib until the first day criteria for CHR are met provided they are confirmed 28 days later and was computed only for chronic phase CML subjects whose best response is CHR. Subjects who neither progressed nor died were censored at date of last hematologic assessment.
outcome.time_frame: baseline; every 4 weeks < 6 months on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454); every 12 weeks >=6 months and <=2 years; every 24 weeks >2 years; at discontinuation
outcome.population: Participants achieving CHR

group.title: CML - Chronic Phase (CML-CP)
group.description: Imatinib resistant or intolerant CML-CP disease cohort who had completed the previous study (CA180031/NCT00337454) phase I/II. The study drug was administered twice daily (BID). The starting dose level for this trial in each individual participant was the same dose level at the end of CA180031(ie, 50mg, 70mg or 90mg BID on a continuous daily dosing schedule), allowed to modify within the range of 50 mg twice daily (BID) to 90 mg BID.

group.title: CML - Accelerated Phase and Blast Phase (CML-AP/BP)
group.description: Imatinib resistant or intolerant CML-AP/BP disease cohort who had completed the previous study (CA180031/NCT00337454) phase II. The study drug was administered twice daily (BID). The starting dose level for this trial in each individual participant was the same dose level at the end of CA180031 (ie, 50mg, 70mg or 90mg BID on a continuous daily dosing schedule), allowed to modify within the range of 50 mg twice daily (BID) to 90 mg BID.

group.title: Ph+ Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia (Ph+ ALL)
group.description: Ph+ ALL subjects with resistance or intolerance to past therapy and who had completed the previous study (CA180031/NCT00337454) phase II. The study drug was administered twice daily (BID). The starting dose level for this trial in each individual participant was the same dose level at the end of CA180031 (ie, 50mg, 70mg or 90mg BID on a continuous daily dosing schedule), allowed to modify within the range of 50 mg twice daily (BID) to 90 mg BID.

measure.title: Time to Complete Hematologic Response (CHR) in Chronic Phase CML, Accelerated or Blast Phase CML, and Ph+ALL
measure.description: CHR=all of the following criteria: WBC ≤institutional upper limit of normal(ULN); platelets <450,000/mm³; no blasts or promyelocytes in peripheral blood; <5% myelocytes plus metamyelocytes in peripheral blood; peripheral blood basophils <20%; no extramedullary involvement. Time to CHR=time from first dose of dasatinib until the first day criteria for CHR are met provided they are confirmed 28 days later and was computed only for chronic phase CML subjects whose best response is CHR. Subjects who neither progressed nor died were censored at date of last hematologic assessment.
measure.population: Participants achieving CHR

outcome.title: Duration of Complete Hematologic Response (CHR) in Chronic Phase CML, Accelerated or Blast Phase CML, and Ph+ALL
outcome.description: Duration of CHR was computed only for chronic phase CML subjects whose best response is CHR. It was measured from the first day complete hematologic response criteria are met provided they are confirmed 28 days later until the date treatment is discontinued due to PD or death. Subjects who neither progressed nor died were censored on the date of their last hematologic assessment.
outcome.time_frame: baseline; every 4 weeks < 6 months on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454); every 12 weeks >=6 months and <=2 years; every 24 weeks >2 years; at discontinuation
outcome.population: Participants achieving CHR. Duration of CHR in the CML AP/BP arm has not yet been reached.

outcome.title: Time to Major Hematologic Response (MaHR) in Accelerated or Blast Phase CML, and Ph+ALL
outcome.description: Major Hematologic Response=Complete Hematologic Response (CHR) or No Evidence of Leukemia (NEL; see Outcome Measures 14 and 15 for full definitions). Time to major hematologic response (MaHR)=time from first dose of dasatinib until the first day the measurement criteria for MaHR and is computed only for advanced diseases subjects whose best response is a major hematologic response. Subjects who neither progressed nor died were censored on the date of their last hematologic assessment.
outcome.time_frame: baseline; every 4 weeks < 6 months on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454); every 12 weeks >=6 months and <=2 years; every 24 weeks >2 years; at discontinuation
outcome.population: Participants achieving MaHR

outcome.title: Time to Overall Hematologic Response (OHR) in Accelerated or Blast Phase CML, and Ph+ALL
outcome.description: The overall hematologic response (OHR) rate is defined as the proportion of all treated subjects with a best response of major or minor hematologic response. Time to OHR = time from first dose of dasatinib until the first day measurement criteria are first met for hematologic response provided they were confirmed 28 days later. Subjects who neither progressed nor died were censored on the date of last hematologic assessment.
outcome.time_frame: baseline; every 4 weeks < 6 months on study (including study CA180031/NCT00337454); every 12 weeks >=6 months and <=2 years; every 24 weeks >2 years; at discontinuation
outcome.population: OHR was computed only for subjects whose best response is CHR or MaHR or Minor HR (MiHR).

outcome.title: Collection of Blood Samples for Pharmacokinetic Analysis of Dasatinib Twice Daily (BID) That Will Contribute to Population Pharmacokinetic Modeling
outcome.description: Blood samples for pharmacokinetic analysis of Dasatinib BID that will contribute to population pharmacokinetic modeling were collected.
outcome.time_frame: At any visit of later than Day 7, draw sample(s) at pretreatment trough (within 1 hour prior to dosing) or between 3 hours following treatment and prior to the next dose
outcome.population: There was no individual PK analysis done for this study; analyses were integrated and evaluated as a part of population PK of this drug.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
